Security Governance is the framework that provides strategic direction, establishes policies, and ensures that security objectives are achieved within an organization.
It involves defining and implementing security policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines to protect an organization's information assets.
Security Governance helps in aligning security strategies with business objectives and regulatory requirements.
It includes roles such as the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) who is responsible for overseeing the organization's security governance.
Understanding security compliance requirements and standards such as GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS, and ISO 27001.
Conducting regular security audits and assessments to ensure compliance with industry regulations.
Implementing security controls and measures to protect sensitive data and prevent unauthorized access.
Developing security policies and procedures to guide employees on compliance best practices.
Training employees on security awareness and compliance to mitigate risks and vulnerabilities.
Monitoring and analyzing security logs and reports to identify compliance issues and potential threats.
Responding promptly to security incidents and breaches to maintain compliance and minimize impact.
Collaborating with legal and regulatory teams to address compliance concerns and requirements.
Maintaining documentation and records to demonstrate compliance efforts and adherence to standards.
Engaging with third-party auditors for independent assessments and validation of security compliance.
Leveraging security tools and technologies to automate compliance checks and monitoring processes.
